verses.kjv: And it came to pass in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah king of Judah, that this word came unto Jeremiah from the LORD, saying,
verses.ct: During the 4th year of King Jehoiakim son of Josiah, who ruled Judah, a message from the LORD came to Jeremiah:

verses.kjv: Take thee a roll of a book, and write therein all the words that I have spoken unto thee against Israel, and against Judah, and against all the nations, from the day I spake unto thee, from the days of Josiah, even unto this day.
verses.ct: "Get a scroll and write down everything I have told you about Israel, Judah, and all the nations — every message since I first spoke to you during the reign of Josiah up to today."

verses.kjv: It may be that the house of Judah will hear all the evil which I purpose to do unto them; that they may return every man from his evil way; that I may forgive their iniquity and their sin.
verses.ct: "Perhaps the people of Judah will hear about all the disaster I plan to bring on them, and each person will turn away from their wicked behavior, so that I can forgive their guilt and their sin."

verses.kjv: Then Jeremiah called Baruch the son of Neriah: and Baruch wrote from the mouth of Jeremiah all the words of the LORD, which he had spoken unto him, upon a roll of a book.
verses.ct: So Jeremiah summoned Baruch son of Neriah, and as Jeremiah dictated, Baruch wrote down on a scroll every message the LORD had spoken to him.

verses.kjv: And Jeremiah commanded Baruch, saying, I am shut up; I cannot go into the house of the LORD:
verses.ct: Then Jeremiah gave Baruch these instructions: "I'm restricted and unable to enter the LORD's temple."

verses.kjv: Therefore go thou, and read in the roll, which thou hast written from my mouth, the words of the LORD in the ears of the people in the LORD’s house upon the fasting day: and also thou shalt read them in the ears of all Judah that come out of their cities.
verses.ct: "So you must go and read from the scroll you wrote as I dictated — read the LORD's words to the people at the LORD's temple on a day of fasting. Also read them to everyone from Judah who has come in from their towns."

verses.kjv: It may be they will present their supplication before the LORD, and will return every one from his evil way: for great is the anger and the fury that the LORD hath pronounced against this people.
verses.ct: "Maybe they will bring their prayers to the LORD and each one will abandon their wicked behavior, because the LORD has declared fierce anger against this people."

verses.kjv: And Baruch the son of Neriah did according to all that Jeremiah the prophet commanded him, reading in the book the words of the LORD in the LORD’s house.
verses.ct: Baruch son of Neriah carried out everything the prophet Jeremiah told him to do, reading the LORD's words from the scroll at the LORD's temple.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass in the fifth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah king of Judah, in the ninth month, that they proclaimed a fast before the LORD to all the people in Jerusalem, and to all the people that came from the cities of Judah unto Jerusalem.
verses.ct: In the 9th month of the 5th year of King Jehoiakim son of Josiah of Judah, a fast was declared in the LORD's honor for everyone in Jerusalem and all the people who had traveled from the towns of Judah to Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: Then read Baruch in the book the words of Jeremiah in the house of the LORD, in the chamber of Gemariah the son of Shaphan the scribe, in the higher court, at the entry of the new gate of the LORD’s house, in the ears of all the people.
verses.ct: Baruch read Jeremiah's words from the scroll at the LORD's temple, in the room of Gemariah son of Shaphan the secretary, which was in the upper courtyard near the entrance of the New Gate of the LORD's temple, where all the people could hear.

verses.kjv: When Michaiah the son of Gemariah, the son of Shaphan, had heard out of the book all the words of the LORD,
verses.ct: When Michaiah son of Gemariah, grandson of Shaphan, heard all the LORD's words read from the scroll,

verses.kjv: Then he went down into the king’s house, into the scribe’s chamber: and, lo, all the princes sat there, even Elishama the scribe, and Delaiah the son of Shemaiah, and Elnathan the son of Achbor, and Gemariah the son of Shaphan, and Zedekiah the son of Hananiah, and all the princes.
verses.ct: he went down to the royal palace, to the secretary's room. All the officials were sitting there — Elishama the secretary, Delaiah son of Shemaiah, Elnathan son of Achbor, Gemariah son of Shaphan, Zedekiah son of Hananiah, and all the other officials.

verses.kjv: Then Michaiah declared unto them all the words that he had heard, when Baruch read the book in the ears of the people.
verses.ct: Michaiah reported to them everything he had heard when Baruch read the scroll to the people.

verses.kjv: Therefore all the princes sent Jehudi the son of Nethaniah, the son of Shelemiah, the son of Cushi, unto Baruch, saying, Take in thine hand the roll wherein thou hast read in the ears of the people, and come. So Baruch the son of Neriah took the roll in his hand, and came unto them.
verses.ct: So all the officials sent Jehudi son of Nethaniah, son of Shelemiah, son of Cushi, to tell Baruch, "Bring the scroll that you read to the people and come here." Baruch son of Neriah took the scroll and went to them.

verses.kjv: And they said unto him, Sit down now, and read it in our ears. So Baruch read it in their ears.
verses.ct: They told him, "Please sit down and read it to us." So Baruch read it to them.

verses.kjv: Now it came to pass, when they had heard all the words, they were afraid both one and other, and said unto Baruch, We will surely tell the king of all these words.
verses.ct: When they had heard everything, they looked at each other in alarm and said to Baruch, "We absolutely must report all of this to the king."

verses.kjv: And they asked Baruch, saying, Tell us now, How didst thou write all these words at his mouth?
verses.ct: Then they questioned Baruch: "Tell us — how exactly did you write all of this? Did he dictate it to you?"

verses.kjv: Then Baruch answered them, He pronounced all these words unto me with his mouth, and I wrote them with ink in the book.
verses.ct: Baruch replied, "He spoke every word to me personally, and I wrote them down with ink on the scroll."

verses.kjv: Then said the princes unto Baruch, Go, hide thee, thou and Jeremiah; and let no man know where ye be.
verses.ct: The officials told Baruch, "You and Jeremiah need to go into hiding. Don't let anyone know where you are."

verses.kjv: And they went in to the king into the court, but they laid up the roll in the chamber of Elishama the scribe, and told all the words in the ears of the king.
verses.ct: They went to the king in the courtyard, but first they stored the scroll in the room of Elishama the secretary. Then they reported everything to the king.

verses.kjv: So the king sent Jehudi to fetch the roll: and he took it out of Elishama the scribe’s chamber. And Jehudi read it in the ears of the king, and in the ears of all the princes which stood beside the king.
verses.ct: The king sent Jehudi to retrieve the scroll, and he brought it from Elishama the secretary's room. Jehudi read it aloud to the king and to all the officials standing around the king.

verses.kjv: Now the king sat in the winterhouse in the ninth month: and there was a fire on the hearth burning before him.
verses.ct: The king was sitting in his winter quarters — it was the 9th month — with a fire burning in the brazier in front of him.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, that when Jehudi had read three or four leaves, he cut it with the penknife, and cast it into the fire that was on the hearth, until all the roll was consumed in the fire that was on the hearth.
verses.ct: Each time Jehudi finished reading 3 or 4 columns, the king would cut them off with a scribe's knife and toss them into the fire in the brazier, until the entire scroll had been burned up.

verses.kjv: Yet they were not afraid, nor rent their garments, neither the king, nor any of his servants that heard all these words.
verses.ct: Neither the king nor any of his attendants who heard all these words showed any fear or tore their clothes in grief.

verses.kjv: Nevertheless Elnathan and Delaiah and Gemariah had made intercession to the king that he would not burn the roll: but he would not hear them.
verses.ct: Even though Elnathan, Delaiah, and Gemariah urged the king not to burn the scroll, he refused to listen to them.

verses.kjv: But the king commanded Jerahmeel the son of Hammelech, and Seraiah the son of Azriel, and Shelemiah the son of Abdeel, to take Baruch the scribe and Jeremiah the prophet: but the LORD hid them.
verses.ct: Instead, the king ordered Jerahmeel the king's son, along with Seraiah son of Azriel and Shelemiah son of Abdeel, to arrest Baruch the scribe and Jeremiah the prophet. But the LORD kept them hidden.

verses.kjv: Then the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah, after that the king had burned the roll, and the words which Baruch wrote at the mouth of Jeremiah, saying,
verses.ct: After the king burned the scroll containing the words that Baruch had written as Jeremiah dictated, the LORD's message came to Jeremiah:

verses.kjv: Take thee again another roll, and write in it all the former words that were in the first roll, which Jehoiakim the king of Judah hath burned.
verses.ct: "Get another scroll and write on it everything that was on the first scroll — the one King Jehoiakim of Judah burned."

verses.kjv: And thou shalt say to Jehoiakim king of Judah, Thus saith the LORD; Thou hast burned this roll, saying, Why hast thou written therein, saying, The king of Babylon shall certainly come and destroy this land, and shall cause to cease from thence man and beast?
verses.ct: "And regarding King Jehoiakim of Judah, say this: 'The LORD declares — You burned that scroll, demanding to know why it said that the king of Babylon would certainly come and destroy this land, wiping out both people and animals.'"

verses.kjv: Therefore thus saith the LORD of Jehoiakim king of Judah; He shall have none to sit upon the throne of David: and his dead body shall be cast out in the day to the heat, and in the night to the frost.
verses.ct: "Therefore, the LORD says this about King Jehoiakim of Judah: None of his descendants will sit on David's throne, and his dead body will be thrown out, exposed to the heat of day and the frost of night."

verses.kjv: And I will punish him and his seed and his servants for their iniquity; and I will bring upon them, and upon the inhabitants of Jerusalem, and upon the men of Judah, all the evil that I have pronounced against them; but they hearkened not.
verses.ct: "I will punish him, his descendants, and his officials for their guilt. I will bring down on them, on the residents of Jerusalem, and on the people of Judah every disaster I warned them about — but they refused to listen."

verses.kjv: Then took Jeremiah another roll, and gave it to Baruch the scribe, the son of Neriah; who wrote therein from the mouth of Jeremiah all the words of the book which Jehoiakim king of Judah had burned in the fire: and there were added besides unto them many like words.
verses.ct: So Jeremiah took another scroll and gave it to Baruch the scribe, son of Neriah. As Jeremiah dictated, Baruch wrote down all the words from the scroll that King Jehoiakim of Judah had burned in the fire, and many similar messages were added to them as well.
